One day, a big, mean cat came to the forest. The cat did not like the bird's lectures. He wanted to catch the bird and stop him from speaking. The cat would hide and wait for the bird to come near.
The little bird was scared, but he knew he had to keep speaking to help his friends. So, he thought of a plan. He told all his friends to work together and scare the mean cat away. They made loud noises and chased the cat out of the forest.
The bird was happy that he could keep giving lectures and speaking to his friends. The mean cat never came back

. Betsy knew that Ollie didn't mean to hurt her. So, she forgave him. They hugged each other and continued to play happily in the sunny field.

. He did not mean to be mean. He only wanted to make Lily laugh. He says, "I am sorry, Lily. I did not know it was mean. I will not do it again. Can we still be friends?"

Ben nods. He says, "Yes, Lily. I can do that. Thank you for being my friend. You are very fair."

was not a friendly dog. It was a mean dog. It barked and growled and showed its teeth. It wanted to bite them.

to the lion, "Why are you so mean? You are big and strong, but you are not happy. You should be kind and share with others. Then you will have friends and be happy."

One day, a mean man came to the land. He did not like the happy rhythm. He wanted to take the drum away. The people did not want the mean man to take their drum. They loved to dance to the rhythm.
The mean man was very strong. He took the drum and ran away. The people were very sad. They could not dance to the happy rhythm anymore. The mean man had won, and the people never danced again.
